topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Suspending and Resuming Instances

body.p: When a user suspends an instance, the contents of the instance are stored on disk and the instance is stopped. Suspending an instance is similar to placing a device in hibernation; memory and vCPUs become available to create other instances.
Users can suspend an instance, for example, to free up the resources used by an instance that is used infrequently or to perform system maintenance.
Note: Suspending is different from pausing an instance. Pausing keeps the instance running, (in a "frozen" state) and stores the content of the instance in memory (RAM).

ol.li: Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Horizon Dashboard.
Select the appropriate region and project.

Based on whether you are working on a project or the domain:
Click the Admin dashboard, then the System panel, then the Instances tab.
Click the Project dashboard, then the Compute panel, then the Instances tab.

In the Instances screen, for the instance you want to suspend, click Edit Instance then Suspend Instance.
The status of the instance reports Suspended.
Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Horizon Dashboard.
Select the appropriate region and project.

Based on whether you are working on a project or the domain:
Click the Admin dashboard, then the System panel, then the Instances tab.
Click the Project dashboard, then the Compute panel, then the Instances tab.

In the Instances screen, for the instance you want to resume, click Edit Instance then Resume Instance.
The status of the instance reports Running.
